definition: (false) bravado/to bluff
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds
power/influence/potential/momentum/tendency/trend/situation/conditions/outward appearance/sign/gesture/male genitals

sentences.english: The first plan goes to hell and then you start tap-dancing.
sentences.chinese: 第一個計劃失敗，你就開始虛張聲勢了。

sentences.english: He was too clever a man to be bluffed.
sentences.chinese: 他是個很靈的人，不會爲虛張聲勢所嚇倒。

sentences.english: It’s neither too sleepy nor too intimidating.
sentences.chinese: 它既不死氣沉沉，也不虛張聲勢。

sentences.english: Potential home buyers afraid of committing to a fast- depreciating asset have been clamoring for signs of stabilization in house prices.
sentences.chinese: 潛在的購房者擔心房價回暖是大肆貶值前的虛張聲勢。

sentences.english: Under you the gambling stake, the checkup gambling house, blusters , even enhances the chip.
sentences.chinese: 你下賭注，覈對牌局，虛張聲勢，甚至提高籌碼。

sentences.english: He needs no bravado to mesmerize spectators.
sentences.chinese: 他不需要虛張聲勢給觀衆催眠。

sentences.english: Vesper:So that would be what you call "bluffing"?
sentences.chinese: 那麼就是要所謂的“虛張聲勢”了？

sentences.english: She bluffed him into thinking that her gun was loaded.
sentences.chinese: 她虛張聲勢恐嚇他，使他誤以爲她的槍是上了膛的。

sentences.english: Someone who has a poker faceusualyusually is good at bluffing.
sentences.chinese: 繃着一張撲克臉的人通常擅長虛張聲勢。

sentences.english: Dr Kassin also tested the impact of bluffing.
sentences.chinese: Kassin博士也測試了虛張聲勢的影響。

sentences.english: Minnelli's sensibilities were perfect for it – the sensitivity and the bravado.
sentences.chinese: 明奈利對情感與虛張聲勢的拿捏是無可挑剔的。

sentences.english: So whether is Da Vinci swashbuckling, is ego acclaimed?
sentences.chinese: 那麼達芬奇是否在虛張聲勢，自我炒作呢？

sentences.english: I was bluffing, attempting to hide my fear.
sentences.chinese: 我虛張聲勢，正努力掩藏自己的恐懼。
纔不呢，她只是虛張聲勢。

sentences.english: Tom was too clever a student to be bluffed.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆是個很聰明的學生，不會被虛張聲勢嚇倒的。

definition: outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to play deaf-mute
to slander/to smear/to vilify
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to stir up public sentiment by false statements (idiom)/to resort to demagogy
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
